TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlSchemaKeyref extends System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaIdentityConstraint

Docs.summary: This class represents the element from XMLSchema as specified by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Specifies that an attribute or element value (or set of values) has a correspondence with those of the specified `key` or `unique` element. The constraint name must be unique within a schema.
## Examples The following example creates a `key` element.
[!code-cs[Classic Webdata XmlSchemaKeyRef Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_4_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic Webdata XmlSchemaKeyRef Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_4_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic Webdata XmlSchemaKeyRef Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_4_1.vb)]
The following XML file is generated for the preceding code example.
[!code-xml[Classic Webdata XmlSchemaKeyRef Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/xml/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_4_2.xsd)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the name of the key that this constraint refers to in another simple or complex type.
Docs.value: The QName of the key that this constraint refers to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Name of a `key` or `unique` element defined in this schema (or another schema indicated by the specified namespace). The `Refer` value must be a QName. The `Refer` value can include a namespace prefix.
